#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Stop Your Child from Lying ( Homework Related )
#Text=Many children lie to their parents about completing their homework .
#Text=When your children lie to you , they may break your trust in them .
#Text=In order to give them your trust back , a series of steps must be followed in order to prevent your child from lying about their homework in the future .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Talking with Your Child
#Text=Find out why your children lie about their homework .
#Text=Take time to listen to their feelings without being overly negative about them lying .
#Text=Just let them talk .
#Text=They may actually have a good reason that you have n't listened to before .
#Text=Explain to them that lying is not acceptable .
#Text=Tell them that it is okay they did n't finish , but remind them that instead of lying , they should ask for help .
#Text=Help them if they are having trouble .
#Text=Talk your way through the concept , work a problem with them , and ask questions to make sure they are comprehending .
#Text=Be supportive of your children .
#Text=If they are having trouble , help them as much as you can and be understanding if they do n't make as good grades as they could .
#Text=Instead .
#Text=encourage them to do better and focus on their strengths .
#Text=Preventing future fibs
#Text=Ask your child to bring you their homework for you to check .
#Text=This is the best way to resolve the problem .
#Text=When they bring you homework , you can see if they 've finished or not and whether they have been lying to you .
#Text=Give them a time when they should be done with their homework .
#Text=At the set time , you will check their homework .
#Text=Remind them they can ask for help at any time .
#Text=Be ready to punish lying if this continues to happen .
#Text=Take away a favorite toy or electronic if they lie again .
#Text=Talk with your child 's teacher .
#Text=Many schools have a great way of allowing parent connection with the teacher .
#Text=The teacher may send e-mails regarding your child 's troubles with homework .
#Text=Then you can try to find a time to meet up with their teacher to address the issue .
#Text=You can also arrange with your child 's teacher a tutoring schedule or having an aide come to the house to tutor your child .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Try turning off the television in the living room to help your child focus on homework .
#Text=If you still want to watch television , maybe you can go to your bedroom instead .
#Text=Confiscate your children 's electronics until their homework is complete .
#Text=This ensures they are not wasting time while they should be doing their homework
#Text=Ask your child to do their homework in a common area ( such as the kitchen or living room ) so you can monitor them while they complete their homework .
#Text=Show genuine care and interest in your child 's life .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Do n't be too hard on the punishment , as your child may get discouraged and not try at all to improve .
